basics.name: Xuezhou Xu
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: B.S. (Honours) in Mathematics (Highest Distinction), National University of Singapore. Research interests: RL, Embodied AI.

work.name: Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering, National University of Singapore
Tsinghua SAIL Group, Tsinghua University
work.summary: Advisors: Prof. Jun Zhu, Prof. Hang Su.
highlights: Developed ManiBox, a bounding-box-guided manipulation framework based on a scalable simulation-driven teacher-student paradigm, improving policy and spatial generalization.
Developed PEAC, a Pre-trained Embodiment-Aware Control algorithm that learns embodiment-aware and task-agnostic priors through online interaction in reward-free environments.

work.name: Existential Robotics Lab, UC San Diego
highlights: Developed methods to prove Lyapunov stability of uncertain dynamical systems and synthesized stabilizing controllers for control-affine systems under model uncertainty.

courses: Core Courses: Machine Learning (A+), Introduction to Artificial Intelligence (A), AI Planning and Decision Making (A+), Linear Algebra (A+), Calculus (A), Stochastic Process (A), Ordinary Differential Equations (A), Mathematical Modeling (A+), Matrix Computation (A+)

publications.name: ManiBox: Enhancing Spatial Grasping Generalization via Scalable Simulation Data Generation
PEAC: Unsupervised Pre-training for Cross-Embodiment Reinforcement Learning

projects.name: Image Deconvolution Using Wavelet Transform
projects.summary: Designed and implemented a Haar wavelet transform framework for denoising periodic signals contaminated with additive Gaussian noise; compared convolution strategies (zero-padding, valid, circular) and thresholding schemes for reconstruction fidelity.

projects.name: Simulator-Driven Policy Learning for Robotics
projects.summary: Extended Isaac Lab to support custom RL algorithms (A2C, SAC, TD3, DDPG, PPO) for large-scale benchmarking; created a 'Throw a Dice' manipulation task with Franka arm using hierarchical reward shaping and curriculum learning; applied domain randomization across object type/scale/position to improve robustness and diversity.

projects.name: Safe Policy Modification via Control Barrier Functions
projects.summary: Investigated safety guarantees in RL by embedding Lyapunov-like control barrier functions into nominal controllers to ensure forward invariance; designed a safeguarding controller with formal proofs and simulations across constrained systems.
